name: Solid strip and plank flooring, hardwood, E
description:
Important note: although most of the data in the US LCI database has 
undergone some sort of review, the database as a whole has not yet 
undergone a formal validation process.
Please email comments to lci@nrel.gov.

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Eastern USA, including the following states: MN, IA, MO, WI, IL, NJ, OH, IN, MI, WV, PA, MD, DW, NJ, NY, ME, VT, NH, RI, MA, CT, VA, KY, AR, LA, MS, AL, FL,GA, NC, SC, TN, and TX
processDocumentation.intendedApplication: Only mass allocation factors are available for the multi-functional processes (disregard economic allocation factor values-they are mass allocation factors).
processDocumentation.restrictionsDescription: All information can be accessed by everybody.

exchanges.description: Moisture content = 8%.  1m3 of finished strip/planked flooring represents on average 31.5m2 to 104 m2 of flooring at 31.7 and 9.65 mm thickness, respectively.

flow.name: Solid strip and plank flooring; hardwood
flow.category: Technosphere Flows/31-33: Manufacturing/3219: Other Wood Product Manufacturing

flow.category: Technosphere Flows/22: Utilities/2213: Water, Sewage and Other Systems

defaultProvider.category: 22: Utilities/2213: Water, Sewage and Other Systems

exchanges.description: Based on density of 657 kg/m3/  (volume at 8% moisture content).  Mismatch with lumber from input process, which has a density = 627 kg/m3 (volume at  9.6% moisture content).

flow.category: Technosphere Flows/CUTOFF Flows/CUTOFF Waste Flows

exchanges.description: Weight reported on an ovendry basis.  Moisture content (ovendry basis) = 8%.  Wood residue includes: dry sawdust, dry planer shavings, dry trimmings, dry edgings, and dry wood flour
